edge: Theodore Decker's mother was killed in the Bombing at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
Theo's mother died while protecting The Goldfinch during the bombing.
Theodore Decker was placed into foster care with the Barbour Family.
Mrs. Barbour encouraged Theodore Decker's interest in antiques and art.
Theodore Decker and classmate Tom Cable were supposed to see the Principal of School that day because they were caught smoking cigarettes.
Theo blames himself for his mother's death due to their early arrival at the museum.

Donna Tartt, the author, reportedly hated the adaptation to the point of firing her longtime agent over it and made it clear she would not sell the rights to any of her work for films again because of the portrayal of Theo's mother's death.
Theo locates the antiques shop of James 'Hobie' Hobart

Andy hints that his parents are considering adopting Theo
Larry arrives with his girlfriend Xandra to relocate Theo to Las Vegas
Theo befriends Boris in Las Vegas
Larry ends up in gambling debt and tries to have Theo transfer his education fund to a banking account but ultimately fails with Xandra
Theo keeps The Goldfinch hidden
Boris kisses Theo and runs away after Larry is killed in a drunk-driving crash
Xandra berates Theo for his apparently apathetic response to his father's death and Theo runs away to New York, taking Xandra's dog Popper and the painting
Hobie allows Theo to live with him in New York
Theo has made Hobie’s shop successful, selling his restored antiques.
Theo runs into Andy's older brother Platt,

Having deduced that Theo stole The Goldfinch, Reeve accuses him of using it as collateral to finance his shop.
Theo becomes engaged to Andy's younger sister Kitsey,
Theo catches Kitsey cheating on him with Tom Cable,
Hobie confronts Theo for the theft and loss of The Goldfinch.
Boris reveals he had stolen The Goldfinch from Theo years prior,
and had used it as collateral to finance his criminal career,
Pippa visits Theo and they confess their feelings for each other,
but she tearfully rejects him, citing the instability caused by their shared childhood trauma.
Boris seizes The Goldfinch at gunpoint in Amsterdam during a plan to recover it with Theo's assistance.
Boris and Theo are ambushed by another pair of criminals in Amsterdam during their mission to recover The Goldfinch.
Theo attempts suicide in his hotel room after being forced to kill one of the assailants in Amsterdam.
Boris is shot during their mission to recover The Goldfinch in Amsterdam and later dies.
Boris rescues Theo after his suicide attempt in the hotel room in Amsterdam.
Boris persuades Theo that their actions to recover The Goldfinch and other stolen art in Amsterdam were for the greater good after calling in a tip to the police.
In July 2014, film rights to The Goldfinch were sold to Warner Bros. Pictures in a deal brokered by ICM Partners.
Warner Bros. Will distribute the film adaptation of The Goldfinch worldwide.

In August 2017, Amazon Studios finalized a deal with Warner Bros. To co-finance the adaptation of The Goldfinch where Amazon would invest in more than a third of the project's budget and obtain streaming rights for Prime service.
On October 4, 2017, after a two-month casting search, Ansel Elgort was cast in the lead role of Theodore 'Theo' Decker in The Goldfinch.

Following its poor opening, many publications labeled The Goldfinch a box-office bomb and estimated it would lose as much as $50 million.
The critical consensus reads, 'Beautifully filmed yet mostly inert, The Goldfinch mishandles its source material, flattening a complex narrative into a largely uninvolving disappointment.'
